page.title: 04Changes in population
page.content: Over the years the population of the villages has fluctuated dramatically. When the original Domesday survey was carried out the population of {Quenington}was about 100,the book only records 44 people, 32 men and 12 slaves, however by assumming that some of the men and slaves had a wife and family a figure of a 100 is a reasonable estimate. Similarly the numbers in{Coln}and{Hatherop}would have been approximately 50 and 25 respectively. After the survey the popultion of the villages steadily rose then suddenly plummeted in the fourteenth century.This was caused by an outbreak of the plague. As there were insufficient farm workers to till the fields many of the farms became sheep farms.
